section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies to coordinated, aggregate in-kind contributions to a candidate from a central committee of a political party.

para.text: Required Reporting — Central Committee. The central committee of a political party making the coordinated expenditure shall report on a campaign finance report the name of the candidate that received the in-kind contribution.
Required Reporting — Candidate Committee. The authorized candidate campaign committee shall report on a campaign finance report:
The name of the central committee of the political party that made the in-kind contribution;
A description of the in-kind contribution; and
The aggregate amount of in-kind contributions made in the election cycle from the central committee of the political party.
Candidate Committees. Coordinated in-kind contribution limits for a central committee of a political party shall be applied to the authorized candidate campaign committee of the candidate.
Slates. Coordinated in-kind contributions limits for a central committee of a political party may not be applied to slate committees.

section.heading: Use of Funds.
section.text: To make in-kind contributions to a candidate, a central committee of a political party:

para.text: Shall use contributions or transfers received pursuant to Election Law Article, §§13-226 and 13-227, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
May not use funds not received in accordance with the contribution limits of Election Law Article, §§13-226 and 13-227, Annotated Code of Maryland.
